Reviews.Content: Loved hotel Panorama at Firenzie We stayed at the Hotel Panorama in Florence for one night in Sept 2008. It was a pleasent experience. The Room was nice and big, very clean with a small attached bathroom. It didnt have air conditioning (You might want that even in Sept) but that was because we had booked an economy room (not the hotels fault). The view from the room was nice, facing the Duomo. The breakfast place was great with a nice view of the city of florence. Nice farm fresh breakfast with the view was an added treat. The lift to the hotel is a little small but still manageable. The hotel is a little away from the train station but any bus going to the San Marco square and a short 3 min walk will take you to the hotel. The front desk staff was excellent. Chrisitina also went out of the way and helped us plan our short excurscion in the city (we had only 1 day in florence) and also loaned us the guide book for the city. It was a pleasure staying at this place and would highly recommend this place to anyone visiting Florence. It is very well located (very near to the Duomo), well connected to the SMN train station and quite a few food joints available around (even for a late night snack). The neighborhood felt safe and the staff very very friendly. All in all a great experience.
Reviews.Author: ChicagoTravelerV

Reviews.Content: good people good location good price I have stayed with my family in this hotel 3 times. I like the location as it is right next to the Duomo and is close to the shops. The new owners are really nice and keen to make your stay enjoyable. The rooms are plain but a decent size. there can be some noise from outside in the mornings as there is a bus stop for coaches at the side. It is only an issue if you are fussy. The breakfast terrace is lovely with views on 3 sides over the roof tops of florence. This is a good value base to stay in an expensive city. I would happily stay here again.
Reviews.Author: mad4jesus

Reviews.Content: A friendly welcome after a long days travel       TERRACE
Reviews.Author: TUSCANRAIDER

Reviews.Content: Great base for exploring Florence       View from No. 36 patio back into room
Reviews.Author: kurtztk

Reviews.Content: Room with a View It was a suprise weekend in florence The Hotel was great location, close / walking distance to all the main sights, The Entrance is a bit dingy but when you get to the 2nd floor reception was birght and airy. Dont be put off by the entrance!Our room - 32 big airy room had air con but didn't need it in May, bathroom big with nice view too! But opening the Shutters and the view 'Panorama' lived up to its name. with access to the balcony just made it for us, WoW.There is a main drop off point for coaches on street below, but we didn't find it a problem as other reviews.Ask for that room!!! Staff very pleasent and helpful.Breakfast was ok, but just enought to keep you going till you hit the Pizza and Ice cream!!!Advice: pack your most comfy walking shoes you will need them
Reviews.Author: Snoopy1974

Reviews.Content: Very good budget hotel We stayed here 3 nights in october 2006. Only superior room available. Big, basic and clean room. Big tiled bathroom. The room floor was also tiled.The best part was the breakfast room balcony outside our window. I don't know why, maybe because it was late in the year, the balcony was never open. All the best for us, because we used it as our balcony. The balcony is facing west and after long days of sightseeing and shopping we usually ended the days on the balcony sharing a bottle of wine in the beautiful sunset with the view of Florence!We had a lovely stay!
Reviews.Author: geddi

Reviews.Content: It's an 'okay' hotel I stayed in Hotel Panorama for 3 nights, during a 2 weeks trip in Italy and Paris. This is the cheapest hotel among the 4 that I've stayed in during this trip.I was a little dissapointed with the hotel, based on what I've read from the reviews on Tripadvisor, which I always think is a good indication of the quality.The price was definitely good, euro75 for a double room, with breakfast provided. The personnel is also very nice, especially when I need to get some medications middle of the night, he rightly directed me to the nearest pharmacy that is still open at that hour.The complaint is mainly on the quality of the room. It is not air-conditioned, and that was fine, as it was not more than 30degree celcius when we were there. But the mosquitoes and noise is really bothering us. I guess I should have asked for the mosquitoes mats, anyway, make sure you do, when they are bugging you. As for noise, our room was sort of near to the alley where a travel bus stand is, hence, when the bus engine is running, it's really noisy, but after 1am was fine. I guess everyone would be in bed by then.It's good value for money, but if the hotel management put more effort in refurbishing the place, there has got a lot of potential. For instance, the dirts/stains on the walls in the room can be easily cleaned, but it wasn't, giving guest an impression that the room is not clean.
Reviews.Author: YunQi

Reviews.Content: Great location!! We loved this hotel, it was in a great location! We were within walking distance to everything and very close to the Accademia Gallery  San Marco Square. A very short walk from the Duomo too. The room was very nice and good size. The bathroom was big, the only problem was there was very little water pressure in the shower. The staff was nice and helpful and breakfast is included. Great for a budget hotel!!
Reviews.Author: Tripgirl24

Reviews.Content: Avoid this place during warm months We booked this place for two nights in May 2007. The experience was not at all pleasant.We booked a 'Superior double room with a view and TV ' and are yet tofigure out what is superior about this room. The room number was 37.It was hot for us in Italy, since we live in a much cooler Berlin. The AC was not working. They had disconnected the power supply since it was still not warm enough for them. Not something you expect when you pay 90 Euros a night!Since I couldn't sleep I kept the window open to let in some cooler air. Big mistake! Lot of mosquitoes also got in. There is a fairly busy road near by. So there was lot of noise too. At last at 1:00 AM I went down to the reception. They could do nothing about our situation. The person there gave a mosquito repellent mat. We put this on and soon the mosquitoes disappeared. The sound of vehicles remained. A bad night's sleep spoils your next day. This is exactly what happened to me. I was drowsy all day. The next day the called the AC technician and reconnected the power supply. The AC was working but it was just blowing air which was not cool. Clearly the compressor had gone bad. Again we let the window open, took another mosquito repellent mat from the reception and slept listening to the noise from the near by road.I am a budget traveller and travelled a dozen European counties. Thiswas my most expensive(90 euros a night) and unfortunately the worst stay. This room had a view of Florence old town. But we had to keep the windows closed in the mornings. In the mornings, when the toilets areheavily used, there is a strong smell of you-know-what if the windowsare open. Maybe a drainage pipe or septic tank had a leak.I wouldn't recommend this place especially for summers. To think thatI had this experience after booking this place after a lot of research in the net is really disappointing.Florence is a nice city, by the way..-rpk
Reviews.Author: rpk44

Reviews.Content: Good Hotel       Bathroom
Reviews.Author: Mtlsouth

Reviews.Content: Pleasant little hotel The Panorama Hotel is a small hotel within walking distance of the Duomo and other sites in Florence. The first level contains private apartments. The reception area is on the second level. There is a very small elevator to all levels. Rooms on the back are simple and relatively quiet. They were quite roomy. There was a large window which opened. Bathrooms were small and crowded but with up-to-date fixtures. Everything was very clean.The breakfast room is on the 4th level. It has beautiful views of the rooftops of the city. The staff was very friendly and attentive.
Reviews.Author: RetiredTeacher72

Reviews.Content: Florence - Hotel Panorama Have slept here 4 nights with my fiance 2 months ago during our trip to Italy: it's a convenient place, clean (!) and well located - a good choice if you are travelling to Florence on a budget.
Reviews.Author: Canarhombre

Reviews.Content: Great Location!!! I stayed here in the beginning of August this past summer and loved it! Located right in the center of town it wasn't a far walk from anywhere. The summer before I stayed on the other side of the river and the walk was quite far from the major sites. I definately recommend staying at the heart of the city and this hotel is totally worth it. Friendly staff, great rooms, and nice breakfast!
Reviews.Author: geo06

Reviews.Content: Great hotel and location! We did a little research on tripadvisor on hotels in Florence that is within our budget and close to all major attraction. We were slightly skeptial on some of the reviews but we were pleasantly surprised in everything! We were lucky to get a really big (compare to European standard) deluxe room with a view of the Duomo and the bathroom is super clean! Breakfast is continental but good enough since the coffee is really good. Staff was really helpful with recommending restaurants. Hotel is about 5-10 minutes walking distance to all major attraction. Then again, all major attraction is within walking distance with each other.
Reviews.Author: Arielarafe

Reviews.Content: room with a view1 we stayed 4 nights at the hotel after walking past it twice we finally found it!!! a great hotel, we booked the room with a balcony overlooking florence. i cant emphasise how much you have to book this room! we spent so much time just sitting out looking at the terracotta roofs and the sunsets. the staff were so helpful, from siteseeing to restaurants. the location is also good, easy to walk to all the sights and hopfully early enough to miss those queues!!breakfast is basic, but good! will stay there again. oh they also have 24 hr reception
Reviews.Author: bakpak

Reviews.Content: Even better the second time around We just came back from our second stay at the hotel and we were delighted to find that the bathroom had been recently renovated. The room was in excellent condition and very clean, as seems to be the tradition at the hotel. Breakfast could have been better...but it is a two star hotel, and given the excellent location, who could ask for anything more?
Reviews.Author: Heidididy

Reviews.Content: Florence Stay After a wonderful week in Florence I'm back in Rome for a couple of days before I catch my return-flight back to the US. I have to say it's really incredible how Florence is constantly able to renews it's very special appeal every time I'm back there. And this time there's even a new small little secret to add: I decided to try a different inn this time and booked at Hotel Panorama. Well, I can say I am more than pleased with my recent discovery: good location, clean rooms, nice and helpful english-speaking peolple at the desk, and all at a decent rate. I'll sure reccomend Hotel Panorama to friends coming to Florence and will definetely stay there again myself.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Great Hotel Stayed at Hotel Panorama in early May this year for my fourth time now and can confirm the good reviews. Our room was once again spotless and you really can鈥檛 beat the hotel鈥檚 perfect location: less than 10 minutes easy walking distance from the Cathedral and just around the corner from the Accademia Gallery. I and my wife keep coming back here each time we are in Florence because the staff - it鈥檚 a family-owned hotel - is always very kind and helpful. And we sure will continue to do so!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Good Value I decided to stay here together with my wife and another couple basing my choice on previous reviews and was not disappointed - once I got past the building entrance. The hotel reception is on the 2nd floor of a larger building but you can easily use the elevator.You may initially feel thrown off by this, but the rooms are more than fine: the ones we were assigned were spotless, though a bit sparse in terms of furnishing. In two words it鈥檚 was definitely a 鈥榞ood pick鈥? The people who own/run place and the staff were nice and friendly and assisted us with all our needs: upon our arrival the person at the front desk gave us a map and highlighted the major points of interest also providing some very good restaurant recommendations for lunch  dinner. Breakfast in the morning was included, Continental style. And the location is excellent for walking around the city centre: the Accademia Gallery, by the way, is just around the corner. I would certainly recommend this hotel for your stay in Florence and hope to be back soon myself.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Clean rooms and friendly staff This was the only 2 star property we stayed at during our entire trip in Italy this winter, so I was a little nervous about it. No reason to worry: clean room, comfortable bed, immaculate bathroom. Plus the hotel has a perfect location: not in a crowded area but only 10-15 minutes away from all major attractions and from the train station. The staff was friendly and very helpful: they had great suggestions for museum reservations and good hints for wonderful dinners in the neighbourhood. It is not the newest or swankiest hotel around, but of great value especially if you consider travelling in low season as we did. We will definetely return here if we have a chance to be in Florence again in the future.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: My place! I found out about the hotel through reviews read on this website and must say that, once there, it even exceeded my (overall high) expectations. Was in Florence last New Year's Eve and the next day and found this place an absolute gem. I've travelled in many different european cities and am quite used to budget hotels but Hotel Panorama definetely surprised me: a very good position in the city center (not common), an absolutely spotless clean room, and - what really impressed me and my wife - a charming staff which really helped us out with the most precious hints about the city's secrets. I highly reccomend this hotel and hope to have a chance to be back soon.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Good Choice Excellent! Stayed at Hotel Panorama during my recent trip to Florence and must say I couldn't have chosen better. Comfortable room, clean and tidy, and perfect location in the town center (only 1 block away from the Accademia Gallery and at convenient walking distance from all major points of interest): all this at a more than decent price. A warm thank you to all the staff for their precious help with suggestions for wonderful meals in nearby restaurants and for beautiful 'non-turisty' hidden spots (you would never know about them unless a local tells you about them) in Florence. Hope to be back soon.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: In a great position, friendly, clean and at a fair price We slept at Hotel Panorama by chance last October during our Tuscany journey: we did not have a reservation and stopped by while driving a rental car. It turned out to be a wonderful change in our original plans: instead of one night we remained four!! It's position is in the city centre, so very convenient and at walking distance from all major spots to visit in Florence: you can park your car and totally forget it. The room was clean and comfortable. The owners were very friendly and helpful and made the stay so much more enjoyable than other places we tried the same way in other cities. Breakfast in the roof veranda was a treat in the morning: coffee and all the rest in front of a gorgeous view!! The day of departure our luggage was safely kept after checkout while we spent our last hours in Florence. Best of all the price we paid was very reasonable! Next time we'll travel to Florence we will definitely stay here again.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Comfortable budget accommodation We stayed 3 nights in Florence last week and slept at Hotel Panorama. The room we were assigned was absolutely spotless and the breakfast was good: nothing fancy but fine...and the coffee was wonderful. And it's in a great position, easy to get to all the major sites. I will definetely stay here again the next time I come to Florence and will recommend this hotel to all my friends.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Decent Accommodations for a Great Price I went on a 6 city, 10 day tour of France and Italy recently. While in Florence we stayed in the Hotel Panorama and out of the 6 very diffrent hotels that I stayed in, it is definately in my top 3. In 4 out of the 6 hotels that we stayed in, you had to climb over the beds to move around the room. The Hotel Panorama is substantially more spacious. I found the decor a little drab, but if you are in a spectacular city like Florence, you should really be spending your time outside seeing the city's rich history. The beds weren't bad and the location was good, not great, but good. You could gert to many of the best sites in 15 minutes or less walking. This hotel is perfect for someone who came to Florence to see the city and enjoy the sites, it's a perfect place to get clean and get some sleep.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Pay a Little Extra and Treat Yourself Better Than This Yuck! Panorama was the only thing this hotel had going for it. Yes, the view is brilliant and the staff is friendly, I'll give them that. But after reading the glowing reviews, we were sorely disappointed. This place was gross -- and I've stayed in some real budget hotels all over Europe, including the Eastern bloc countries. Bugs everywhere, paper-thin walls where you can hear the man next door blowing his nose, stale reek of cigarettes, Sanka for breakfast, wet drizzle for shower, and dishtowels for bathroom towels.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: A Wonderful Hotel and Great Value We were very happy with this hotel. Although it was slightly out of the way, it was still only a 10 minute walk from the Duomo and right near the Accademia. They have a wonderful terrace view of the city, which can be enjoyed from the room and breakfast area. The room and bathroom were plain but clean, and large for european standards. And the staff was extrememly friendly and helpful - they wnt out of their way to get reservations for the Uffizi Gallery and called to make our dinner reservations. Would absolutely recommend staying here - it was by far the best of 4 hotels we stayed at in Italy. And it was a great value as well.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Perfectly agree: an excellent choice I and my friends stayed 3 nights at this hotel last week and we have no complaints at all about it. In fact we must say we were a little skeptic as we booked because some of the latest reviews we read about it were not so nice. But we did indeed find a very friendly and helpful staff and the cleanest rooms and bathrooms in all our trip in Europe. Plus the location is really super: just around the corner from Academy Gallery (Michelangelo's David) and only a few minutes away from all the other attractions in the city center. I definitely recommend this place if you want a good place for the money.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Excellent Choice! I am very surprised to read some of the unflattering comments about this hotel. Given that it is rated as a 2star hotel I think that it is well rated and probably exceeds what I expected.I was a little surpised to find it on the upper floors above apartments but this did not cause us any inconvenience. The lift is a little small though if you had a pram or a few cases. The staff were all very friendly and helpful.The room was very adequate and not cramped. Had air con (which could be timed to go on and off - very handy!), a TV, writing desk and wardobes etc - all you need when living out of a case. The bathroom was clean and spacious and contained the greatest surprise of all - a great view of the Duomo. Half the rooms face onto a side street as ours did and there was very little noise.Breakfast was fine. Tea/coffe, a roll a pastry, juice and cereal. No chance of it running out either like in other hotels as you were each given a basket at your table which meant you could go for breakfast when it suited you as opposed to running to make sure you got stuff.As for location we found it great! Right beside the Accedemia Museum housing Davids statue (book for this museum if visiting - queues are crazy!). Everything was walking distance. The station was about a 15min walk but there were loads of buses. The 7 bus drops you at Piazza San Marco, a stones throw away! The Duomo was all of 7mins walk away,and the Ponte Vechio about 20. But its all very pleasant walking terrain so you dont notice it pass by!For the cost of the room, I found this hotel more than adequate and perfect for our needs.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Surprising  Gee!!! I was curious to check the latest reviews on Hotel Panorama just before leaving for my journey to Italy, and specifically to Florence, and almost panicked! What the hell I thought, all the past reviews seem to describe a good place and now, all of a sudden, such a bad one - something doesn't sound right - where is the truth??.Well, I found out myself. Now that I've been to it myself I have no doubts at all on Hotel Panorama's value.I understand we don't all see the world with the same eyes and that what may look beautiful to a person doesn't necessarily have the same effect on others, but still.....: a fact is a fact and there is no further story to that. As a regular tripadviser user I try to be as objective as possible when I write a review on a place I've stayed at clearly holding to my mind what kind of structure I'm talking about (in this case a 2 star budget hotel) in order value it correctly. Otherwise why bother at all? To vent my personal frustration in the case of a bad experience? Or, in the opposite case, to glorify a cowshed as the owner offered me a beer every night? Nope, believe me, not really.... And I truly believe it's the same for most reviewers or Tripadvisor wouldn't be so highly appreciated by users all over the world.But now to the hotel. It's position is quite good: a block away from the Accademia Gallery (the museum where the Michelangelo's astonishing original David stands) and maybe a 7-8 minutes easy walk from the Cathedral. River Arno and the Ponte Vecchio are another 10 minutes away passed the Duomo. So everything reasonably close I would say. I was assigned a room on the 4th level which was yes basic but perfectely functional and spotlessly clean. No private minibar in the room but fresh drinks available for guests at the front desk if needed (of course this doesn't mean you can use the refrigerator to store your private belongings in it - do I really have to explain why....???). Maybe other reviewers are used to lodging in 4-5 star hotels: if this is the case I wonder why they booked a 2 star budget hotel instead, huh.......? Back to the room: the view from it towards the Cathedral was really quite amazing. The rate was within EUR 80,00 per night for two persons (double room staying 3 nights) which I found fairly adequate. Last but not least: the staff was very friendly and provided a couple of very good suggestions for a nice evening only local people would know about.So, summing all the factors, I can definetely can say Hotel Panorama is an excellent choice in Florence for budget travellers.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Good location We have just returned from a 2 night stay at this hotel. We would describe the rooms as clean but very basic, the beds were comfortable, although our bathroom was in need of a new loo seat as this was badly cracked. We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was basic but adequate. After requesting more tea and coffee on the first day - we do not function until we've had at least two cups of tea/coffee in a morning - the waitress brought us a large pot of coffee and extra tea bags the following morning as soon as we sat down. There was no balcony with our room - we were on the 2nd floor and our room looked onto the street and we would say that there was a lot of early morning noise! Hotel was well positioned for seeing all the sights - only a 10 minute walk from San Lorenzo (good little restaurants here), the Duomo etc. We would say it was farther from the railway station than anticipated and with baggage a taxi is essential! Also hotel is on 2nd floor of a building that also houses apartments. The lift was out of order on our arrival at lunchtime so we had to carry our cases up the stairs. Luckily the lift was working again later that day. We hope to return to Florence as it is a beautiful city but we probably would not return to this hotel.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Clean but basic Agree with other reviewers that this hotel provides value for money within a good central (ish) location for exploring Florence. However, I suspect that our room on the fourth floor was not one of the hotel's best. Whilst undoubtedly clean and upgraded in parts, it was a little shabby around the edges. The towel rail was hanging off the bathroom door and we could have done with a shower curtain. However, that being said, I would certainly recommend this hotel if you are looking for basic but clean accommodation at a reasonable price (We paid 70 Euros per night). The views are also spectacular provided you have a serious head for heights!
Reviews.Author: curfewgull

Reviews.Content: Poor Location and unfriendly service. Was looking for a nice cheap hotel to stay in with my wife for five nights.No doubt i was blinded by the beautiful photos on the trip advisor web site.We were given a wonderful view of the duomo .The room was very spacious but reminded me of a school camp dorm.The tacky pictures and nasty dull wall coverings seemed out of place when compared to the view and the newly tiled bathroom.Nasty smelly pillows and a creacky sagging bed did nothing for our opinion of this hotel.The hotel is a decent hike from the train station.I thought it was in a poor position.There is very little in the way of resteraunts and the management would not allow me to put my alcohol in the reception fridge which meant after making the 15 min trek to by some beer it had allready gone warm.The breakfast was sparse even for european standards.One cup of coffee ,one small breadroll and a small pastry.I don't recommend this hotel and would not stay there again......even with the great views
Reviews.Author: kuwaithammer

Reviews.Content: Excellent Value!!! I and my fiance stayed at Hotel Panorama for 3 nights earlier this month, during our roundtrip in Italy, basing our choice on the reviews we had previously read in TripAdvisor. The hotel was exactly as we expected: family-run and located in the centre of Florence short walks away from all the major points of interest. Our room was spotless and people at the front desk were very helpful giving us nice hints like only locals really can (superb restaurants choices for example). Truly, thinking what we have spent, I must say they have an excellent quality-service/price ratio: well done! I highly recommend a stay in this hotel if you are travelling in Florence and will definetely come back myself.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: What a Sight!   showReview(3676334, 'full');
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: great hotel for the value   showReview(3605020, 'full');
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Love the Hotel Panorama!   showReview(3544414, 'full');

Reviews.Content: Nice, friendly, near historical centre   showReview(3515974, 'full');

Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay   showReview(3254661, 'full');

Reviews.Content: Good Panorama!   showReview(2262339, 'full');

Reviews.Content: Posizione, cortesia e prezzo ragionevole   showReview(22543157, 'full');
Reviews.Author: Rescue_diver_61

Reviews.Content: Il due stelle col Web e l'aria condizionata       La quadrupla del "Panorama".
Reviews.Author: ErasmodaRotterdam

Reviews.Content: Lo consiglio.   showReview(20091723, 'full');
Reviews.Author: cip08

Reviews.Content: hotel pourri   showReview(16168802, 'full');
Reviews.Author: lilithemiss

Reviews.Content: Muy centrico   showReview(6856833, 'full');
Reviews.Author: insolit

Reviews.Content: Soggiorno nell' Albergo Panorama   showReview(4094540, 'full');
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: 銈ㄣ儸銉欍兗銈裤兗銇屾様銇倐...   showReview(19928480, 'full');
Reviews.Author: lass=
